title: The Best Yoga Retreats in Europe
text:
The Best Yoga Retreats in Europe 2015-05-1 This page comes from the website NetGlobers. It has been printed on 2015-07-31 at 00:18. The original can be found here : . Travel report of Spain Cleanliness, hygiene, water quality, allergen control... Food safety Getting around, in cities or in the countryside... Is transport safe and reliable? Is public transport frequent? Are taxis easy to find? Transport Finding a safe place to stay, the cleanliness and quality of accomodation... Accomodation Being able to communicate with locals, or get in touch with people at home... And what about phones and internet access? Communication Medical facilities, emergency services, doctors, pharmacies, exotic diseases... Are the hospitals clean and well-staffed? Is it easy to find a doctor, or a pharmacy when you need them? Health care - based on 103 travel reports - by Ljuben   
Although, the roots of yoga can hardly be traced to Europe until just recently, its growing popularity means that all its philosophy is widely accepted by people from any culture. I really can’t think of a better spot to practice yoga than quiet location, surrounded by nature, far away from the crowds of tourists you can see in pretty much every holiday location. I’ve decided to prepare a list with the top suggestions to consider for your creative yoga holiday in Europe, as a source I used one of the leading creative holiday websites Neal’s Yard Holidays : Costa Blanca, Spain 
Spain is known for having the most breath-taking sceneries of the Mediterranean Sea and Costa Blanca is no exception. Surrounded by mountains, with beautiful view over the Mediterranean, the luxury yoga retreats seem to be just what you need to simply relax and enjoy yourself. With some of the best professionals in the country, the staff will do all it takes to make you feel good and regenerate your strength. Dalyan, Turkey 
Although, Turkey is probably most famous for its Mediterranean beaches, the insides of the country carry huge doze of nature charm. The city of Dalyan is located at tranquil spot, near river delta and you can also visit the nearby Turtle beach conservation area. At the retreat, you can learn to prepare traditional Turkish cuisine, practice yoga or meditation or simply relax by the pool. Mali Losinj, Croatia 
The Adriatic coastline of Croatia is such a mysterious, rustic location that tourists from all over Europe visit it during the summer. However, away from the busy city streets there are some amazing spots hidden in the rugged cost and Mali Losinj is just that. Not only that, but the retreat offers you the unique opportunity to tap into 7 powers of Breakthrough Success, which will truly help personal growth. If you want to truly experience what creative holidays are all about then make sure you visit Mali Losinj! Klavze, Slovenia 
Western Slovenia has that rustic European charm and Klavze is small village offering tourists a grasp of the local culture and cuisine. The location allows tourists to experience the tranquillity of the valley of the Baca river and also enjoy the highly experience staff at the retreat. Even if you don’t take any of the amazing activities offered at the retreat, such as rafting, hiking and swimming, the clean mountain air will do wonders for your body. La Roane, France 
If I somehow have the chance to get the summer of my dreams, I will most likely visit rural France, as I am really looking forward to experience the charm of this country without bumping into crowds of tourists. La Roane is located in the Southwest part of the country and there you have the rare opportunity to enjoy multiple activities, experience vegetarian French cuisine, prepared by award winning chef and also just relax at the spa. Furthermore, its just 3 miles away from the St. Antonin medieval market, a spot definitely worth visiting! ...
